Models

class api.models.AppUser(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Represents an application-specific user, extending the Django User model.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

color_id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
task_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id
user_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class api.models.Task(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Represents a task with details like title, description, due date, priority, category, and status. Tasks can be assigned to multiple AppUsers.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

assigned_to

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Tests

class api.tests.AuthTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for authentication-related actions, including registration, login, and guest login.

setUp()

Set up initial data for tests, creating a test user, app user, and token for authentication.

test_guest_login()

Test the guest login functionality, allowing anonymous users to log in.

test_login_user()

Test the login process for an existing user.

test_register_user()

Test the user registration process.

class api.tests.ContactTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for actions related to contacts, including creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting contacts.

setUp()

Set up initial data, including creating a test user, app user, and token.

test_create_contact()

Test creating a new contact.

test_delete_contact()

Test deleting an existing contact.

test_get_contacts()

Test retrieving a list of all contacts.

test_update_contact()

Test updating an existing contact.

class api.tests.SubtaskTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for actions related to subtasks, including retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting subtasks.

setUp()

Set up initial data, creating a test user, app user, task, subtask, and token.

test_create_subtask()

Test creating a new subtask.

test_delete_subtask()

Test deleting an existing subtask.

test_get_subtasks()

Test retrieving a list of all subtasks.

test_update_subtask()

Test updating an existing subtask.

class api.tests.TaskTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for actions related to tasks, including retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting tasks.

setUp()

Set up initial data, creating a test user, app user, task, subtask, and token.

test_create_task_with_subtasks()

Test creating a task along with its subtasks.

test_delete_task()

Test deleting an existing task.

test_get_tasks()

Test retrieving a list of all tasks.

test_update_task()

Test updating an existing task and its associated subtasks.

class api.tests.UsersTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for actions related to user retrieval, including getting all users and the current user.

setUp()

Set up initial data, including creating a test user, app user, and token.

test_users()

Test retrieving the list of all users.

test_users_current()

Test retrieving the current logged-in user.

URLs

Utils

api.utils.check_email_availability(email)

Checks if an email is already taken in the user database. If the email is taken, it returns a 400 error response.

api.utils.get_login_response(app_user, token)

Returns the login reponse as is common for a successful login post request. It requires the corresponding AppUser and Token object.

api.utils.send_password_reset_email(email_address, reset_url)

Sends a password reset email. The reset URL links to the frontend and must contain a valid token.

Views

class api.views.ContactsView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Manages CRUD operations for the user’s custom contacts.

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>]
delete(request, *args, **kwargs)

Deletes a custom contact by its primary key and returns an appropriate status.

get(request, format=None)

Returns all custom contacts for the authenticated user.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
post(request, format=None)

Creates a new custom contact for the authenticated user and returns it.

put(request, *args, **kwargs)

Updates an existing custom contact for the authenticated user.

class api.views.CurrentUserView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Returns the currently authenticated app user’s details.

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>]
get(request, format=None)

Returns the app user details for the currently authenticated user.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
class api.views.GuestLoginView(**kwargs)

Bases: ObtainAuthToken

Allows guest users to log in by creating or using an existing guest account.

login_existing_guest(username)

Logs in an existing guest user by their username and returns a token.

post(request, *args, **kwargs)

Logs in an existing guest or creates a new guest account, then returns a token.

class api.views.LoginView(**kwargs)

Bases: ObtainAuthToken

Handles user login by validating credentials and returning an authentication token.

post(request, *args, **kwargs)

Authenticates the user and returns a token along with app user details.

serializer_class

alias of EmailAuthTokenSerializer

class api.views.RegisterView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Handles user registration by creating new users and AppUser objects.

authentication_classes = []
permission_classes = []
post(request, format=None)

Registers a new user and checks if the email is available. Returns the created user data or errors.

class api.views.RequestPasswordReset(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Handles password reset requests by creating a password reset object.

permission_classes = []
post(request)

Executes the password reset request logic.

serializer_class

class api.views.ResetPassword(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Performs password reset and deletes the corresponding password reset object.

post(request)

Executes the password reset logic.

class api.views.SubtasksView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Manages CRUD operations for subtasks.

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>]
delete(request, *args, **kwargs)

Deletes a subtask by its primary key and returns an appropriate status.

get(request, format=None)

Returns all subtasks in the system.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
post(request, format=None)

Creates a new subtask and returns the created subtask.

put(request, *args, **kwargs)

Updates an existing subtask and returns the updated subtask.

class api.views.TasksView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Manages CRUD operations for tasks and their associated subtasks.

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>]
delete(request, *args, **kwargs)

Deletes a task by its primary key and returns an appropriate status.

get(request, format=None)

Returns all tasks in the system.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
post(request, format=None)

Creates a new task with subtasks and returns the created task.

post_task_with_subtasks(task_serializer, subtasks_data)

Creates a task along with its subtasks and returns the created task.

put(request, *args, **kwargs)

Updates an existing task and its subtasks.

put_task_with_subtasks(task_serializer, subtasks_data)

Updates a task and its subtasks, then returns the updated task.

class api.views.UsersView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Returns a list of all app users in the system.

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>]
get(request, format=None)

Returns all app users in the system.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
async api.views.subtasks_stream(request)

Sends empty events to the client for subtask data update notifications.

async api.views.tasks_stream(request)

Sends empty events to the client for task data update notifications.

async api.views.users_stream(request)

Sends empty events to the client for user data update notifications.
